fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: Immortalized brown preadipocytes were induced to mature adipocytes with supplementation of asparagine during differentiation. Gene expression was analyzed on differentiation day 6.

Gene expression analyzed by quantitative PCR in brown adipocytes that were fed with or without 1mM asparagine as in (A). n=3 independent experiments. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

Oxygen consumption rate measured by clark electrodes for mature brown adipocytes as in (B). n=4 independent experiments. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

Left: UCP1, PGC1α and PPARγ protein levels were analyzed in brown adipocytes (day 6). Cells were supplemented with 1mM asparagine from day 4 to day 6. Right: quantification of protein levels. n=3 biological replicates. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Preadipocytes bearing the shRNA targeting Pgc1α were induced differentiation with or without 1mM asparagine. Protein expression was analyzed on day 6. n=3 biological replicates.

Primary preadipocyes isolated from mice BAT were induced to differentiation in DMEM media with or without 1mM asparagine. Left: UCP1 and PPARγ protein levels were analyzed on day 6. Right: quantification of protein levels. n=3 biological replicates. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Brown preadipocytes were infected by lentiviral shRNAs against Asns. Cells were differentiated in culture media with or without 1mM asparagine. Western blot was performed on day 6.

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: C57BL/6J male mice fed on a chow diet drank water with or without asparagine at a concentration of 1.5g L-1 for 3 weeks. Mice were acutely exposed to 4˚C for 6 h to measure rectal temperature or intraperitoneally (i.p.) injected CL316,243 (1mg kg-1 body weight) for one time for other assays.

Mice serum amino acid concentration after 3-weeking asparagine feeding. n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Asparagine content in BAT of mice in (B). n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

Rectal temperature was measured when mice in (A) was challenged to 4˚C. n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

E,F. Serum insulin (E) and triglyceride (F) concentration was assayed in mice 24 h after one dose of CL316243 injection. n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
UCP1 and PPARγ protein levels in BAT and inguinal WAT (iWAT) from mice in (E).
Representative pictures of BAT and inguinal WAT (iWAT) hematoxylin and eosin staining from mice in (E). Scale bar: 20μm for BAT, 50μm for iWAT.

I,J. Mice supplemented with asparagine in drinking water for 3 weeks were subjected to the indirect calorimetry analysis at both basal (I) and CL316,243-stimulated (J) states. n=5 mice each group.
Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: C57BL/6J male mice were injected with asparaginase (ASNase) or PBS every three days for 2 weeks. Mice were exposed to 4˚C for 6 h before sacrifice for gene expression analysis.
Serum asparagine and aspartic acid concentration in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Rectal temperature in mice of (A) during cold exposure. n=5 mice each group.
BAT and inguinal WAT (iWAT) gene expression analysis in mice of (A).
Serum triglyceride levels in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Hematoxylin and eosin staining of BAT, inguinal WAT (iWAT) and epididymal WAT (eWAT) of mice in (A).

fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: C57BL/6J male mice fed on a high-fat diet drank water with or without asparagine (1.5g L-1) for 18 weeks. In the last 4 weeks, mice were injected CL316,243 daily (0.5mg kg-1 body weight).
Body weight of mice in (A) during the high-fat diet feeding. n=5 mice each group.

Glucose tolerance test was performed after a high-fat diet feeding for 17 weeks in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group.
Serum insulin levels in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group.
Serum triglyceride levels in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Fat mass weight in mice of (A). n=5 mice each group. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Representative histology pictures for BAT, inguinal WAT (iWAT) and epididymal WAT (eWAT) in mice of (A).
BAT and inguinal WAT (iWAT) UCP1 and PPARγ protein levels in mice of (A).

fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: Heat map of metabolite relative levels in brown fat cells treated with or without 1mM asparagine.

Quantification of representative metabolic intermediates of glycolysis in brown fat cells as in (A). n=3 independent experiments. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.
Schematic illustration of key enzymes in glycolysis and tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle.
Immunoblot detection of the glucose transporters, glycolysis and TCA key enzymes in primary brown fat cell line Asparagine was supplemented to cells during differentiation.

Immunoblot detection of the glucose transporters, glycolysis and TCA key enzymes in immortalized brown fat cell line (E), BAT from mice fed asparagine (F) and injected asparaginase (G). Asparagine was supplemented to cells during differentiation.

fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: Brown adipocytes were induced differentiation with or without 1mM asparagine. [U-13C] glucose was added into culture media on differentiation day 6 for 30 min. Then tracing analysis from U-13C glucose was performed.

Intracellular abundance of 13C-isotopologue metabolites downstream of glycolysis in brown adipocytes. n=5 independent experiments. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

C,D. Quantification of glucose (C) and lactate (D) concentration from media. The media was collected after incubated with mature brown adipocytes for 48 h. n=3 independent experiments in (C), n=6 independent experiments in (D).
Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: Quantification of intracellular amino acid levels in brown fat cells (day 6) treated with or without 1mM asparagine. n=4 independent experiments. Data information: Data represent means±SEM. *P<0.05; **P<0.01; ***P<0.001; unpaired two-tailed Student's t test.

B-D. mTORC1 pathway activity was analyzed by immunoblotting for the phosphorylation of 4E-BP1 and S6K in brown adipocytes (B), BAT from mice fed asparagine (C) or asparaginase (D). (B) Asparagine was added to cultured media from day 4 to day 6.
A Click-iT AHA labeling assay to detect newly synthesized glycolytic enzymes. The level of HSP90 in total cell lysates was used as a loading control.
Brown preadipocytes were induced to differentiation with or without 1mM asparagine. Rapamycin (75nM) was added to cells for 48h. Then western blot detected protein expression on day 6.
Brown preadipocytes were knocked down Raptor following standard induction to mature adipocytes with or without asparagine supplementation. Protein expression analysis was performed on day 6.
